item.title: TMC - Defects - Vegetation problem, 30th June
item.description:
Arbs Team Required Overgrown Tree Blocking Visibility on Traffic Light Column Please Cutback (In photos the top column on left hand side is completely hidden on approach from Andoversford to Northleach) 4-Way Traffic Lights (Currently another company already has TM on this junction, so cannot raise as a NWD, but the traffic lights are switched off with temporary lights in place, currently) (Embankment & Cuttings)
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: A pothole in road problem, 30th June
item.description:
Wide pothole that is down to the concrete, this needs inspection please.
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Blocking a Public Highway, 30th June
item.description:
Brandon Terrace Lane, Cheltenham is a public highway. It gets blocked from time to time by builders vans and their materials. I believe it is illegal for them to park their vans there, causing a blockage. The police say it is Highways responsibility. To date this has not stopped an ambulance of fire engine from getting through.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 45, Gratton Road, Naunton, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet
item.category: Obstruction by unpermitted skip, scaffolding, building material on pavement

item.title: Residual stump trip hazard, 30th June
item.description:
Dear Reader, Iâ€™m a resident of 23 Ewlyn Road. In the last year or so, two tress have been removed from the footpath on the road. However, it is not clear why these trees were removed, please can someone explain why they were removed? The latest tree removal has also left a roughly 1m section protruding from the ground. This is still enough to cause a trip, and in my opinion presents more of a hazard than when it was a tree. Are there plans to finish the job? Finally, are there anymore plans to remove trees? May I suggest that NARA, Nauton park residents association, is contacted before any future removals. Best Regards, Nick Alexander
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 21, Ewlyn Road, Naunton, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Large scale pruning has taken place on the public footpath in Prestbury from St Mary's School to the Noverton estate outside 6 Honeysuckle Close off Whitethorn Drive. It is claimed by the contractor that this has been taken place in the garden of No 6 but it is quite clear that the trees are outside the garden and by the edge of the public footpath. Would the house owner or the contractor have had to get a permit this work and is it possible to check if this work was legal?, 30th June
item.description:
Large scale pruning has taken place on the public footpath in Prestbury from St Mary's School to the Noverton estate outside 6 Honeysuckle Close off Whitethorn Drive. It is claimed by the contractor that this has been taken place in the garden of No 6 but it is quite clear that the trees are outside the garden and by the edge of the public footpath. Would the house owner or the contractor have had to get a permit this work and is it possible to check if this work was legal?

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 4, Honeysuckle Close, Noverton, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Flyposting, 30th June
item.description:
Under the prom flyposting yet again. This business is prolific for attaching signs to road signs, lights and railings across the area from Cheltenham to Gloucester and Tewkesbury

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): A40, Elmbridge, Gloucester
